intro: Perezia integrifolia, commonly known as the smooth-leaved perezia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in temperate climates with well-drained conditions. Its leaves are broad, lance-shaped, and have a smooth margin, contributing to its common name. Perezia integrifolia produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in the spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
